member.name: T:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading
member.summary: CustomLoading

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.IsPlayingAnimation
member.summary: Indicates whether the animation is playing or not.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.AnimationSpeed
member.summary: Speed which the animation plays. Default value = 100ms.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new loading control.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.StartAnimation
member.summary: Starts playing the animation for an indefinite amount of time.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.StartAnimation(System.Double)
member.summary: Starts playing the animation and then stops after a certain amount of time in milliseconds.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.StopAnimation
member.summary: Stops playing the animation.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.StopAnimation(System.Double)
member.summary: Stops playing the animation after a certain amount of time in milliseconds.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomLoading.InitializeComponent
member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: T:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar
member.summary: CustomTitleBar

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.#ctor(System.Windows.Window,System.Windows.Controls.Grid)
member.summary: Creates a new title bar control to be used within another window with a grid as its first child.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.#ctor(System.Windows.Window,System.Windows.Controls.Grid,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new title bar control to be used within another window with a grid as its first child and an icon.
The icon must be a local resource name in the parent window's project (e.g. "icon.ico"). If no icon with the given name is found then the title bar will try to extract the icon from its parent window's assembly.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.IsDraggingWindow
member.summary: Indicates if the control is being dragged around by the user.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.IsPlayAnimation
member.summary: Sets if the control will have an animation when hiding/showing the control.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.AnimationInterval
member.summary: Sets how fast the animation plays in milliseconds. Lower values = fast animation, higher values = slow animation. Default value = 25.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.IsAutoHide
member.summary: Sets if the control will auto hide after a certain period of time.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.AutoHideDelay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds that will pass before the control auto hides.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.HideControl
member.summary: Hides the control.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.ShowControl
member.summary: Shows the control.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.BackgroundOpacity
member.summary:
Transparency value of the background. Values between 0 and 1, where 0 = completely transparent and 1 = completely opaque. For it to work the parent window AllowsTransparency property must be set to true.
The AllowsTransparency property of a WPF window can only be set if the window has not been shown yet.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Background color of the title bar.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.SetBackgroundColorHex(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the background color based on a hexadecimal color code. The color code is composed of four sets of two hexadecimal numbers like for example: #FF0fa7ff
The first two digits being the alpha transparency (FF), the third and fourth being the red (0f), the fifth and sixty being the green (a7) and the seventh and eighth being the blue (ff). You can omit the transparency if you wish.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.TextColor
member.summary: Text color of the title bar.

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.SetTextColorHex(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the text color based on a hexadecimal color code. The color code is composed of four sets of two hexadecimal numbers like for example: #FF0fa7ff
The first two digits being the alpha transparency (FF), the third and fourth being the red (0f), the fifth and sixty being the green (a7) and the seventh and eighth being the blue (ff). You can omit the transparency if you wish.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DoubleClickResize
member.summary: Indicates whether or not it should change the state of the window when the title bar is double clicked.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.Text
member.summary: Text to be displayed in the title bar.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.TextAlignment
member.summary: Title bar's text alignment.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.MinimizeButtonVisibility
member.summary: Changes the visibility of the minimize button.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.MaximizeButtonVisibility
member.summary: Changes the visibility of the maximize button.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.CloseButtonVisibility
member.summary: Changes the visibility of the close button.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.WindowDragMode
member.summary: Sets in which states the window can be dragged.

member.name: T:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DragMode
member.summary: States in which the window can be dragged.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DragMode.None
member.summary: The window cannot be dragged at all.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DragMode.Normal
member.summary: The window can only be dragged when its state is set to normal.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DragMode.Maximized
member.summary: The window can only initiate drag when its state is set to maximized.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.DragMode.Both
member.summary: The window can be dragged when in both normal and maximized states.

member.name: P:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.FullScreenMode
member.summary: If fullscreen mode is enabled when maximized the window will cover the whole screen, including the taskbar.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.POINT.x
member.summary: x coordinate of point.

member.name: F:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.POINT.y
member.summary: y coordinate of point.

member.summary: Construct a point of coordinates (x,y).

member.summary: Return the HashCode for this struct (not garanteed to be unique)

member.summary: Determine if 2 RECT are equal (deep compare)

member.name: M:MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.RECT.op_Inequality(MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.RECT,MyControlsLibrary.CustomTitleBar.RECT)
